blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options for the unstructured grid, including spatial reference and units.

variables.name: LENGTH_UNITS
variables.description: Length units used for the model grid and all spatial data.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the length units for all spatial dimensions. Must be consistent with all input data.

variables.name: NOGRB
variables.description: Keyword to deactivate writing of the binary grid file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, the binary grid (GRB) file is not written. The GRB file contains grid connectivity information used by post-processing tools.

variables.name: XORIGIN
variables.description: X-coordinate of the origin of the model grid.
variables.tooltip: The x-coordinate of the grid origin in a real-world coordinate system. Used for spatial referencing and GIS integration. Default is 0.0.

variables.name: YORIGIN
variables.description: Y-coordinate of the origin of the model grid.
variables.tooltip: The y-coordinate of the grid origin in a real-world coordinate system. Used for spatial referencing and GIS integration. Default is 0.0.

variables.name: ANGROT
variables.description: Counter-clockwise rotation angle of the model grid about the origin, in degrees.
variables.tooltip: Rotates the grid around the origin point. A positive value rotates counter-clockwise. Default is 0.0.

blocks.name: DIMENSIONS
blocks.description: Grid dimensions defining the number of nodes and connections.

variables.name: NODES
variables.description: Total number of nodes (cells) in the unstructured grid.
variables.tooltip: The total count of cells in the model. Each node represents a control volume where the flow equation is solved. Nodes are numbered from 1 to NODES.

variables.name: NJA
variables.description: Total number of connections plus the number of nodes (size of the JA array).
variables.tooltip: The total length of the JA (connection) array, which includes one entry for each node (self-connection) plus one for each connection to a neighbor. NJA = NODES + total number of connections.

blocks.name: GRIDDATA
blocks.description: Grid geometry data defining cell elevations, areas, and activity.

variables.name: TOP
variables.description: Top elevation of each cell, an array of size NODES.
variables.tooltip: The top elevation for each cell in the unstructured grid. For cells representing the uppermost layer, this is typically the land surface or top of aquifer.

variables.name: BOT
variables.description: Bottom elevation of each cell, an array of size NODES.
variables.tooltip: The bottom elevation for each cell. Must be less than the top elevation. The difference (TOP - BOT) defines the cell thickness.

variables.name: AREA
variables.description: Horizontal area of each cell, an array of size NODES.
variables.tooltip: The plan-view area of each cell in length-squared units. Used for computing storage terms, recharge, and ET. Each cell can have a different area in an unstructured grid.

variables.name: IDOMAIN
variables.description: Integer array indicating active (1), inactive (0), or vertical pass-through (-1) cells.
variables.tooltip: Controls which cells are active. 1 = active (simulated), 0 = inactive (excluded), -1 = vertical pass-through (flow passes through but no equation solved). Default is 1 for all cells.

blocks.name: CONNECTIONDATA
blocks.description: Cell connectivity data defining the topology of the unstructured grid.

variables.name: IAC
variables.description: Number of connections (plus one for the cell itself) for each cell.
variables.tooltip: For each cell, IAC is the count of connections including the cell itself. For example, a cell connected to 4 neighbors has IAC = 5. The sum of all IAC values must equal NJA.

variables.name: JA
variables.description: Cell connection array listing the cell itself followed by all connected cell numbers.
variables.tooltip: For each cell n, JA contains IAC(n) entries: the first is the cell number n itself, followed by the connected cell numbers. Connections to cells with lower numbers are listed first (upper triangle).

variables.name: IHC
variables.description: Connection type indicator: 0 for vertical, 1 for horizontal, 2 for horizontally staggered.
variables.tooltip: For each connection in JA: 0 indicates a vertical connection (between layers), 1 indicates a horizontal connection with cell centers at the same elevation, 2 indicates a horizontal connection with staggered cell centers. Self-connections are set to 0.

variables.name: CL12
variables.description: Distance from the cell center to the shared face with each connected cell.
variables.tooltip: For each connection, the distance from the cell center to the connection interface. Used to compute conductance. For vertical connections, this is the vertical distance. Self-connections are set to 0.

variables.name: HWVA
variables.description: Horizontal width or vertical area of the connection face.
variables.tooltip: For horizontal connections (IHC=1,2), this is the width of the connection face perpendicular to flow. For vertical connections (IHC=0), this is the horizontal area of the connection. Self-connections are set to 0.

variables.name: ANGLDEGX
variables.description: Angle (in degrees) between the x-axis and the line connecting two cell centers for horizontal connections.
variables.tooltip: The angle measured counter-clockwise from the positive x-axis to the connection direction. Used with the XT3D formulation and for anisotropy calculations. Only needed for horizontal connections. Self-connections are set to 0.
